text: you know I was trying although I was
being a part of the tournament to to
raise the awareness about what's going
on because I thought looking at the
international media that there hasn't
been too much awareness and too much
talk about about floods in Serbia that
haven't been worse in last hundred and
thirty years so people are struggling
people are losing homes and in a suburb
of Belgrade in the small city of Oprah
no it is the worst by far situation in
last four days there has been a lot of
casualties that still the government is
not to you know to name and to to number
because they are still discovering new
bodies as the flood is backing up so
it's been in a very emotional week for
me a part of me is very happy to win the
tournament here in Rome that is a big
one in our sport on the other hand my
thoughts and all my love was with with a
close ones and with my people in Serbia
I'm not pointing a finger and blaming
any network or any international media I
was just trying to to to use my status
to use my position and contribute in
such way for my country in these
difficult times to you know to attract
more attend and to get more broadcast
form from the news in Serbia and that
was that was the whole idea and our
purpose of of my actions in last two
days but the most important thing is to
say that after the floods are over and
after the situation is is better we are
going to have a period of several months
and might take also several years of
recovery and getting people to the
stable ground and getting people to
their normal lives and having the the
home and the roof above their heads and
that is the process that the the length
of the process depends on the help that
that's you know actually gets from from
abroad that that that is why I and
several other athletes and famous people
from our country have been trying to to
raise this awareness internationally
